review: I got in on the preorder deal with this little stick which was just under 20 bucks so it wasn't a very hard decision. I also own the Roku stick which I replaced with the Fire stick. Man what a difference! To be fair, both the Fire and Roku end up at the same place with Netflix, HBO GO, etc. but getting there is the main difference between the 2. The Roku is slow. When I bought the Roku it was the only stick in town so I didn't have much of a choice. The Fire is fast and the interface is beautiful. The instruction recommend against usb power and suggest using the included usb-to-ac adapter. Since my tv is mounted on the wall and I'm going for the no-wire appearance, a 3rd power plug was not an option for me. I used a micro usb-to-usb cable and plugged it into my tv's usb port and the Fire worked just fine. Unless Roku can pack the power into a little stick like Amazon did with the Fire the choice seems obvious to me which one to choose.
author: Mark MC "Riff Merchant"

review: I preordered the Fire TV Stick when it was first announced, for the Prime introductory price of $19.99 and waited for a couple or three months for it to be in stock again and delivered.  That price was too much, considering the fact in only worked well for a month.  That month, I greatly enjoyed the extra speed (over my old Roku), the menus and app options, and the sharp video.  And then.  The device started stuttering while streaming from ANY service—Amazon, Netflix, Hulu.  There would be half second or full second skipping, a stutter, in which the sound would continue as normal but the video would lock briefly before resuming.  Very annoying.  After a week or so of that, the video started locking up completely, freeze-frame, while the sound would continue.  This was not a case of poor internet connectivity or speed; at those times, I'd just turn on my PS4 to watch whatever I had been trying to watch on the Fire TV Stick.  It got to the point that I'd just turn on my PS4 instead of even bothering with the Stick.  I also noticed that the Stick was VERY hot to the touch.  I eventually disconnected the Stick entirely and returned to using my slower but much more dependable Roku.  It's a shame, really.
author: Curtis G. Weeks
